N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 366.7 - Special allowances

State Regulations

The provisions of Part 352 of this Title governing
eligibility for additional allowances do not apply to CAP participants unless
specifically outlined below. CAP participants may be eligible for the following
additional allowances
(a) Property
repairs. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.4
(d) of this

Title. (b) Security deposits, moving expenses and broker's or finder's fees. Eligibility must be determined
in accordance with section
352.6
(a) of this

Title. (c) Repair, maintenance or
retention of housing. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.6
(e) of this

Title. (d) Storage costs. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.6
(f) of this

Title. (e) Home establishment. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.7
(a) of this

Title. (f) Catastrophic replacement
of clothing or furniture. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with
section
352.7
(d) of this

Title. (g) Replacement of
lost/stolen checks or electronic benefits. Eligibility must be determined in
accordance with section
352.7
(g)(1) and
(2)
of this Title. (h) Chattel mortgages. Chattel mortgages must
only be authorized as a one-time only payment. Eligibility must be determined
in accordance with section
352.7
(f) of this

Title. (i) Camp fees. Eligibility
must be determined in accordance with section
352.7
(i) of this

Title. (j) Pregnancy allowance. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.7
(k) of this

Title. (k) Burials. Eligibility
must be determined in accordance with section
352.7
(n) of this

Title. (l) Removals. Eligibility
must be determined in accordance with section
352.7
(o) of this

Title. (m) Visitor's allowance. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with section
352.29
(f) of this

Title. (n) Advance shelter
allowance to avoid eviction. CAP participants who are threatened with eviction
because of shelter arrearage may request an advance allowance to forestall
eviction. The amount of the advance allowance must not exceed the cost of the
participant's shelter for the three months prior to the advance allowance
request and must only be made when other potential arrangements cannot resolve
the shelter emergency. No advance allowance must be provided if the district
determines that the CAP family will not have sufficient income or resources to
meet future rental costs. Any advance allowance authorized is to be considered
an overpayment subject to recoupment. (o) Repair of heating equipment, cooking
stoves and refrigerators. Eligibility must be determined in accordance with
section
352.7
(b) of this
